data.title: Best Mexican brunch I've had north of U.S. 71
data.text: Great food cooked with care, fresh horchata, live mariachi who should have his own records made if he already doesn't, and a very attentive staff.  Loved it, will be back.

data.title: The Best Fajitas and Pastries
data.text: We tried this restaurant for the first time ever because we had a certificate from Restaurant.com. What a pleasant surprise. The food was incredible and authentic Mexican food. The pastries and cookies on display were screaming, "Try me!" and we did. So happy we ventured out of our comfort zone and tried somewhere new to us. We definitely will go back again and again!

data.title: Spot On
data.text: Stopped here for breakfast on Sunday. They serve a great bowl of menudo. Tortillas are hit off the griddle. Chips are fresh and salsa is good...kind of sneaks up on you. We enjoyed the old man playing the guitar. Would we go back? Definitely!

data.title: Authentic and reasonably priced
data.text: Stopped in for early lunch and so glad we did.  I had 2 authentic carne asado tacos...which means small round corn tortillas with grilled meat, onion and cilantro.  My extra refritos added to the enjoyment.  Hubby had chile relleno that was HUGE and delicious.  Their hot sauce was a bit hot on first taste, but got milder as the amount in the bowl decreased.  This meal tasted as good as tacos and food we have had in Todos Santos, Baja.  There is also a panederia (bakery) but too stuffed to try one.  Will be back for hubby to get huevos rancheros.  And glad we live near Lubbock so we can come often.
